algorithms.compGeometry

Class MedialAxis

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.compGeometry.MedialAxis

  • public class MedialAxis
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to create a 2D medial axis given shape points and the boundary. from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medial_axis "the medial axis of a subset S which is bounded by planar curve C is the locus of the centers of circles that are tangent to curve C in two or more points." The class uses a Voronoi diagram, removes the boundary connecting edges, and then tries to remove points that are not medial axis points that are artifacts of small bumps in the shape boundary. The class is a work in progress, so there may still be non-medial axis points that have not been removed yet.
    Author:
    nichole

    • Method Detail

      • setToApplyLineThinner

        public void setToApplyLineThinner()

      • fastFindMedialAxis

        public void fastFindMedialAxis()
        find the medial axis, but with the warning that it may contain extra spikes out to false medial axis points that are artifacts of bumps in the boundary of the shape. The artifacts are not harmful for the main reason the class was built, so this faster method is offered as an option. The runtime complexity is purely that of Voronoi Fortune Sweep, O(N * log_2(N)) where N is the number of boundary points.

      • findMedialAxis

        public void findMedialAxis()

      • getMedAxisAsEdges

        protected java.util.List<thirdparty.voronoi.VoronoiFortunesSweep.GraphEdge> getMedAxisAsEdges()
        return the results as the graph edges. The output is copied so modifications won't affect the instance variables.
        Returns:

      • getMedialAxisPoints

        public java.util.Set<algorithms.util.PairInt> getMedialAxisPoints()
        return the results as undirected point sets. Note that the method runtime complexity is O(N_edges) because it creates points between the edge endpoints.
        Returns:

      • getBoundary

        public java.util.Set<algorithms.util.PairInt> getBoundary()
